column2: Save the date: Global TBO Symposium (4-6 June 2024)
column3: Towards global trajectory-based operations (TBO)

column2: European Commission workshop addresses key challenges in seafaring profession
column3: Decarbonisation, digitalisation, social security and wellbeing at sea were the key topics on the agenda of the workshop for the seafaring profession on 17 January.

column2: “Europe for Aviation” teams up for Airspace World 2024
column3: The “Europe for Aviation” partners, consisting of nine European aviation organisations working to promote the modernisation, sustainability, and resilience of a safe European aviation, will come together at Airspace World, from 19-21 March 2024 in Geneva, Switzerland.

column2: December Infringements package: key decisions
column3: December Infringements package: key decisions

column2: Provisional agreement on more sustainable and resilient trans-European transport network brings Europe closer together
column3: TEN-T Trilogue

column2: Joint Statement on Higher Airspace Operations (HAO)
column3: Joint Statement on Higher Airspace Operations (HAO) by the EU, the US, Canada, Japan, and the UK.

column2: Moldova receives additional funding to improve rail infrastructure and advance Solidarity Lanes
column3: The European Investment Bank has today signed a €41.2 million loan with Moldova, destined to improve internal transport connections as well as to provide long-term economic benefits to the wider region. This loan will be complemented by an EU grant of €12 million.

column2: Single European Sky: Performance Review Body publishes new reports prior to fourth reference period of performance and charging scheme (RP4)
column3: The Performance Review Body (PRB) of the Single European Sky has today published three reports on air navigation service costs.

column2: New website of the EU Urban Mobility Observatory
column3: New website of the EU Urban Mobility Observatory

column2: Call for applications for the selection of members of the Digital Transport and Logistics Forum (DTLF)
column3: The Commission is calling for applications with a view to selecting members for the DTLF other than Member States' authorities and other public entities.

Transport ministers from the Western Balkans, Georgia, Moldova, and Ukraine, as well as the European Commission, gathered at the annual Ministerial Council Meeting of the Transport Community in Skopje, North Macedonia, on 12 December 2023.

column2: Statement by Commissioner for Transport Adina Vălean on the Poland–Ukraine border
column3: Commissioner for Transport Adina Vălean welcomed the re-opening of Dorohusk–Yahodyn border crossing point for freight transport, the most significant border crossing point between Poland and Ukraine.

column2: Open letter from European Transport Commissioner Adina Vălean on standardised weights and dimensions for hand luggage
column3: Open letter from European Transport Commissioner Adina Vălean on standardised weights and dimensions for hand luggage

column2: Call for experts for the Commission Expert Group on the Human Dimension of the Single European Sky (CEGHD)
column3: The Commission is calling for applications with a view to selecting members of the Expert Group on the Human Dimension of the Single European Sky.

column2: EU and Canada strengthen ties on maritime safety
column3: The Commission and the Canadian Department of Transport signed a Memorandum of Cooperation that will improveinternational cooperation on maritime safety.

column2: Commission updates EU Air Safety List and bans Fly Baghdad from flying in the European Union
column3: Aviation Safety: Commission adopts new EU Air Safety List – an air carrier certified in Iraq added

column2: Passenger Mobility Package
column3: The Commission adopted a series of proposals designed to improve the experience of passengers and travellers by strengthening their rights.

column2: Commission welcomes new UN Aviation Agency global target for sustainable aviation fuels
column3: The Commission welcomes the agreement on a global framework for sustainable aviation fuels and other cleaner aviation energy.

column2: November infringement package: key decisions
column3: November infringement package: key decisions

column2: European Commission adopts new proposal on combining transport modes for more sustainable freight
column3: The proposal on combined transport aims to make freight transport more sustainable by improving the competitiveness of intermodal freight – the transportation of goods using two or more transport modes – vis-à-vis road-only transport.

column2: EU signs grant agreements for transport infrastructure to better connect Moldova with EU
column3: The Commission welcomes the signature of three grant agreements under the CEF for Transport worth almost €45 million to improve transport connections between Moldova and Romania along the TEN-T network.
European aviation leaders have come together in Valencia for the 12th edition of the ECAC/EU Dialogue, reaffirming their commitment to sustainable aviation.

column2: Smarter journey planners, better access for emergency services, and more sustainable transport thanks to revised Intelligent Transport Directive adopted today
column3: The Commission welcomes the final approval of the revised Intelligent Transport Systems (ITS) Directive.

column2: Q&A – Assistance to passengers for flight disruptions caused by the conflict in Israel
column3: Q&A

column2: Excellence in Road Safety Awards: European Commission rewards best road safety projects
column3: The Commission is hosting the 2023 Excellence in Road Safety Awards. The awards recognise the best contributions by the European Road Safety Charter's community of organisations, authorities and companies towards safer roads across Europe.

column2: Road safety: 20,640 people died in a road crash last year – progress remains too slow
column3: The 20,640 deaths on EU roads last year represented a 4% increase in relation to 2021, as traffic levels recovered after the pandemic.

column2: RLCF Alliance marks milestone in the pursuit of sustainable aviation and maritime fuels
column3: The second General Assembly of the RLCF Value Chain Industrial Alliance (RLCF) took place, heralding a significant step towards the production of sustainable and renewable aviation and waterborne fuels.

column2: October infringement package: key decisions
column3: October infringement package: key decisions

column2: Commission refers Spain to the Court of Justice of the European Union for failing to correctly transpose and apply EU rules establishing a single European railway area
column3: The Commission decided to refer Spain to the Court of Justice of the European Union for failing to correctly transpose and apply Directive 2012/34/EU establishing a single European railway area.

column2: Single European Sky: annual monitoring shows impact of continued lack of air traffic management capacity with negative consequences for environment and climate
column3: The Performance Review Body (PRB) has published the 2022 Annual Monitoring Report and Traffic Light System as part of its annual monitoring of the performance of the Member States of the Single European Sky (SES).

column2: Final adoption of ReFuelEU Aviation completes ‘Fit for 55' legislation, putting EU on track to exceed 2030 targets
column3: The Commission welcomes today's adoption of two final pillars of its ‘Fit for 55' legislative package for delivering the EU's 2030 climate targets.

column2: Commission proposes list of principles to boost cycling across Europe
column3: The proposal for a European Declaration on Cycling recognises cycling as a sustainable, accessible and inclusive, affordable and healthy means of transport, with strong added value for the EU economy.

column2: Commissioner Vălean: Opening speech at Urban Mobility Days 2023
column3: Commissioner Vălean: Opening speech at Urban Mobility Days 2023

column2: Single European Sky: European Commission advised to prioritise environmental performance when setting performance targets for air navigation services
column3: The Performance Review Body (PRB) for the Single European Sky (SES) has published its advice on EU-wide target ranges for the fourth reference period (2025 - 2029) of the SES performance and charging scheme.

column2: September infringement package: key decisions
column3: September infringement package: key decisions

column2: European Commission adopts 8th report on development of the rail market
column3: The eighth Rail Market Monitoring Report (RMMS) on the state of the EU rail market shows positive developments in 2019, before a significant change in traffic volumes in 2020 due to COVID-19.

column2: Sustainable transport: €7 billion available for key infrastructure projects under the Connecting Europe Facility (CEF)
column3: The Commission launches a call for proposals under the Connecting Europe Facility (CEF) for Transport.

column2: Single European Sky: new framework for interoperability rules
column3: The Commission has adopted a new set of rules to better manage interoperability between the systems and constituents used to provide air traffic management (ATM) and air navigation services (ANS).

column2: European Mobility Week: 3,000 cities to showcase their approaches to sustainable urban mobility
column3: Sustainable and energy-efficient mobility are the focus of this year’s European Mobility Week, which kicks off in 3000 towns and cities in 50 countries.

column2: Evaluation confirms European Union Aviation Safety Agency (EASA) fit for purpose
column3: A Commission evaluation of Regulation (EU) 2018/1139 on common rules in the field of civil aviation and establishing a European Union Aviation Safety Agency (‘EASA’) has given a positive appraisal of EASA’s performance and added value.

column2: Alternative fuels infrastructure: €352 million in EU funding for low-and zero-emission transport projects
column3: The Commission announced 26 projects from 12 Member States that will receive funding to install alternative fuels infrastructure along the trans-European transport network (TEN-T).

column2: Rail Transport: New harmonised EU standards to support cross-border rail
column3: The Commission published a package of revised technical standards to improve rail interoperability across borders – the so-called ‘Technical Specifications for Interoperability’ (TSIs).

column2: Solidarity Lanes: European Commission team of experts visits Romania to discuss capacity of Danube corridor
column3: The programme includes visits to the port facilities and meetings with authorities, operators, transporters and traders. The discussions will focus on means to tackle bottlenecks, increase handling capacity, improve transit and streamline procedures and controls.

column2: Call for applications for the selection of members of a sub-group to the Expert Group on Road Infrastructure Safety
column3: Call for applications for the selection of members of the sub-group to the Expert Group on Road Infrastructure Safety entitled "Forgiving roadsides and self explaining and self enforcing roads".

column2: European Green Deal: Energy Efficiency Directive, FuelEU Maritime Regulation and Alternative Fuel Infrastructure Regulation adopted, helping make the EU ‘Fit for 55'
column3: The Commission welcomes the final approval today of the revised Energy Efficiency Directive, FuelEU Maritime Regulation, Alternative Fuel Infrastructure Regulation (AFIR), as part of the ‘Fit for 55' package of legislation to reduce EU greenhouse gas emissions by at least 55% by 2030.

column2: July Infringements package: key decisions
column3: July Infringements package: key decisions

column2: Vacancy for an HR Officer (establishment of a reserve list) (Contract Agent– FGIV) at the Europe's Rail Joint Undertaking (EU-RAIL)
column3: The deadline for applications is 21/08/2023

column2: Green Deal: Greening freight for more economic gain with less environmental impact
column3: The Commission is today proposing measures to make freight transport more efficient and more sustainable, by improving rail infrastructure management, offering stronger incentives for low-emission lorries, and better information on freight transport greenhouse gas emissions.

column2: Study sets out step-by-step plan for better EU rail connections with Ukraine and Moldova
column3: A study assessing the options for increasing rail connectivity and interoperability between the EU, Ukraine and Moldova has concluded that the first step to improving connections between Poland and Ukraine...

column2: Maritime transport emissions: Commission welcomes new IMO climate ambition for 2030, 2040 and 2050 and calls to set transition in motion
column3: The Commission welcomes the agreement reached today at the International Maritime Organization (IMO) to revise its 2018 strategy on reducing greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions from ships.

column2: June infringement package: key decisions
column3: June infringement package: key decisions

column2: Joint Communiqué by the U.S. Department of Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg and the European Commissioner for Transport, Adina Vălean on transatlantic cooperation
column3: Secretary of Transportation of the United States of America, Pete Buttigieg and European Commissioner for Transport, Adina Vălean, met on May 22, 2023, to discuss EU-U.S. support to Ukraine, ongoing cooperation in aviation and maritime transport, as well as issues of common interest in transport.

column2: Road Transport: Commission proposes to adapt rules on driving and rest times for drivers of occasional bus and coach services
column3: The Commission today proposed to adapt EU rules on breaks and rest periods for drivers to better reflect the nature of occasional bus and coach services. Drivers in this sector have a different work rhythm compared to those in freight or regular passenger transport.

column2: Decarbonising aviation: European Commission to support development of sustainable aviation fuels around the world
column3: The Commission announced support for the development of sustainable aviation fuels (SAF) under the International Civil Aviation Organization’s (ICAO) Capacity-building and Training for Sustainable Aviation Fuels programme (ACT-SAF)?

column2: Connecting Europe: Commission signs high-level agreements with Western Balkans to improve transport links
column3: The Commission signed high-level agreements with Albania, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Kosovo, Montenegro, North Macedonia and Serbia.

column2: European Commission further integrates Moldova into EU Single Market through the Connecting Europe Facility for infrastructure funding
column3: Commissioner for Transport Adina Vălean and Moldova’s Prime Minister, Dorin Recean, signed an agreement in Chisinau, associating Moldova to the Connecting Europe Facility (CEF) programme.

column2: Road transport emissions: Road charging advantages for efficient trailers
column3: The Commission proposes to take into account the effect of trailers on the CO2 emissions of heavy-goods vehicles in road charging schemes that differentiate tolls based on vehicles’ CO2 emissions.

column2: EU transport infrastructure: EUR 790 million available for military mobility
column3: The Commission launches a call for proposals under the CEF for projects that address both civilian and defence needs along the trans-European transport network (TEN-T)

column2: Urban Mobility Days
column3: Save the Date for Urban Mobility Days 2023 taking place from 4-6 October in Seville, Spain.

column2: European Green Deal: new law agreed to cut aviation emissions by promoting sustainable aviation fuels
column3: The Commission welcomes the political agreement on the ReFuelEU Aviation proposal between the European Parliament and the Council.

column2: EU and India deepen ties at aviation summit
column3: The EU-India Aviation Summit in New Delhi confirmed the shared objective of further deepening EU-India political, technical, and industrial cooperation on aviation.

column2: EU – India Aviation Summit: Opening speech by Commissioner Adina Vălean
column3: Opening speech by Commissioner Adina Vălean at the EU – India Aviation Summit.

column2: April Infringements package: key decisions
column3: April Infringements package: key decisions

column2: Vacancy for a post of Executive Director (Temporary Agent– AD14) at the Europe's Rail Joint Undertaking (EU-RAIL)
column3: The deadline for applications is 15 May 2023 at 12.00 noon (Central European Time/ Brussels time)

column2: Continuously open call for applications for the selection of member organisations of the Stakeholders Advisory Group on Maritime Security
column3: The Commission is calling for applications with a view to renewing the membership of the informal expert group entitled ‘Stakeholders Advisory Group on Maritime Security’ by selecting members other than Member States' authorities.

column2: First RLCF workshop: recent developments and projects to boost production and supply of renewable and low-carbon fuels
column3: RLCF Value Chain Industrial Alliance have held their first workshop, discussing the latest developments within the industry and presenting projects in areas such as feedstock sourcing, fuel production, and the uptake of aviation and maritime fuels.

column2: Maritime transport: Commission continues to recognise Filipino seafarer’s certificates
column3: The Commission has decided to continue recognising certificates for seafarers issued by the Philippines, one of the world’s largest maritime labour supply countries.

column2: European Commission publishes key indicators of road safety in Europe
column3: The Commission has published the results of the Baseline project on 8 key performance indicators that influence road safety in Europe.

column2: European Green Deal: ambitious new law agreed to deploy sufficient alternative fuels infrastructure
column3: The Commission welcomes the political agreement reached between the European Parliament and the Council to boost the number of publicly accessible electric recharging and hydrogen refuelling stations in particular across the European Union's main transport corridors and hubs.

column2: European urban mobility awards: Braga and Metropolia GZM rewarded for their green mobility actions
column3: The Commission presented the European urban mobility awards for 2022.

column2: European Green Deal: Agreement reached on cutting maritime transport emissions by promoting sustainable fuels for shipping
column3: The Commission welcomes the political agreement reached between the Parliament and the Council that increases the maritime transport sector's contribution to reaching the EU-wide target of reducing net greenhouse gas emissions by at least 55% by 2030, and to achieving climate neutrality in 2050.

column2: Reducing transport emissions: Commission adopts guidelines to improve vehicle inspections
column3: The European Commission today published a recommendation to improve the periodical technical inspection of vehicles.

column2: Alternative fuels infrastructure: €189 million in EU funding for projects supporting greener mobility
column3: The Commission announced 26 projects from 12 Member States selected for funding to install alternative fuels infrastructure along the trans-European transport network (TEN-T).

The modernisation of 178 km of the Palermo-Catania line will reduce current travel times by a third, linking the two cities with a direct two-hour rail service, which will have a significant impact on economic, social, and sustainable development in Sicily.

column2: Commission guides Member States on sustainable urban mobility planning
column3: On 8 March, the Commission adopted a Recommendation designed to help Member States support their towns and cities in cutting transport emissions and improving urban mobility.

column2: Sustainable Transport Forum – new membership appointments
column3: Appointment of the Members of the group of experts on alternative transport fuels ('the Sustainable Transport Forum')

column2: European Commission proposes updated requirements for driving licences and better cross-border enforcement of road traffic rules
column3: Commission proposes updated requirements for driving licences and better cross-border enforcement of road traffic rules
The finalists for the EUROPEANMOBILITYWEEK award 2022 and the first-ever MOBILITYACTION award have been announced.

column2: Road safety in the EU: fatalities below pre-pandemic levels but progress remains too slow
column3: Road safety in the EU 2022: Around 20,600 people were killed in road crashes last year

column2: February infringements package: key decisions
column3: February infringements package: key decisions

column2: Public workshop on the Multimodal Digital Mobility Services initiative
column3: The Commission will organise a stakeholder workshop on the ongoing impact assessment on the initiative on Multimodal Digital Mobility Services (MDMS), including the retained provisions from the Code of Conduct of Computerised Reservation Systems.

column2: Union for the Mediterranean: Transport Ministers reaffirm Euro-Mediterranean cooperation
column3: The Transport Ministers of the Union for the Mediterranean (UfM) reaffirmed the shared objectives of regional cooperation by adopting the UfM Ministerial Declaration and a new Regional Transport Action Plan (RTAP) when they met on 9 February.

column2: Maritime transport: supporting industry by reducing the administrative burden
column3: The Commission is taking another important step today towards the implementation of the European Maritime Single Window environment (EMSWe) with the publication of a Delegated Regulation and an Implementing Regulation.

column2: Commission tables extension to EU-Ukraine road transport agreement
column3: The EU has proposed an extension to the temporary road transport agreement signed with Ukraine, which has allowed Ukrainian hauliers to increase their operations on EU roads by around 40%.

column2: Multimodal Passenger Mobility Forum – final report
column3: The Multimodal Passenger Mobility Forum (MPMF) was set up to assist the Commission in the preparation of policy initiatives in the field of sustainable multimodal mobility for passengers.

column2: Public workshop on creating a common European mobility data space (EMDS)
column3: Stakeholder workshop for the upcoming Communication on creating a common European mobility data space (EMDS).

column2: Stakeholder conference on mitigating the social impact of the transition to automation and digitalisation in transport
column3: The Commission plans to issue a Recommendation in 2023 on means to mitigate the impact of the transition to automation and digitalisation on the transport workforce.

column2: Connecting Europe by train: 10 EU pilot services to boost cross-border rail
column3: The European Commission will support 10 pilot projects to establish new rail services or improve existing ones.

column2: CINEA launches a new public dashboard covering all of its projects and programmes
column3: The European Climate, Infrastructure and Environment Executive Agency (CINEA) has launched its online public dashboard bringing together all the programmes that have been entrusted to it by the European Commission.

column2: January Infringements package: key decisions
column3: January Infringements package: key decisions

column2: New EU rules on dedicated airspace for drones enter into force
column3: As of today, EU rules establishing a dedicated airspace for drones known as the U-space become applicable, allowing unmanned air service operators to provide a wider range of safe and efficient services.

column2: Factsheet: EU solidarity with Ukraine - latest figures
column3: EU solidarity with Ukraine - latest figures on EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes and more

column2: EU transport infrastructure: speeding-up investment in military mobility
column3: The Commission is speeding up the financing of 35 military mobility projects to support the transport of troops and equipment along the trans-European transport network (TEN-T).

column2: "Europe for Aviation” teams up for Airspace World
column3: The “Europe for Aviation” partners will come together at Airspace World (formerly World ATM Congress), from 8 to 10 March 2023 in Geneva, Switzerland.

column2: New Mobility Patterns Study: insights into passenger mobility and urban logistics
column3: Results of a broad study on new mobility patterns, unveiling the mobility choices of citizens across the EU, and how the urban logistics sector is developing in 16 cities.

column2: Future Mobility: €40 million EIB loan for Cabify to finance a zero-emission fleet of electric vehicles in Spain
column3: The EIB is providing the Spanish multi-mobility platform Cabify with a €40 million loan to decarbonise its fleet of vehicles in Spain, by increasing the availability of new electric vehicles and charging infrastructure across the country.

column2: New shipping fuel standards to reduce sulphur oxides in the Mediterranean by 80%
column3: The Commission welcomes the agreement reached by the IMO to step up protection of the Mediterranean, with a considerable tightening of the rules on exhaust gases from ships.

column2: Vacancy for one post of Seconded National Expert at the Europe's Rail Joint Undertaking (EU-RAIL)
column3: The deadline for applications is 31/01/2023 at 23:59 (Central European Time/ Brussels time)

column2: EU-Ukraine Solidarity Lanes: Commission and EBRD join forces to step up transport connectivity between the EU, Ukraine, and Moldova
column3: The European Commission and the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) defined infrastructure needs and funding resources to step up transport connectivity between the EU, Ukraine and Moldova as part of the Solidarity Lanes initiative.

column2: Financing transport infrastructure in Ukraine and Moldova along the Solidarity Lanes
column3: Speech by European Commissioner Adina Vălean
